places/iactaleia/avasoryd/amberreach/amb.title: Amberreach
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/amberreach/amb.description:
This country was formed within the last few decades.It was previously part of Fallencall and ruled by a Wizard Lord who experimented on his population. His experiments on Goblins created Hobgoblins, with the intention for them to serve as his army.A band of his “subjects” rose up as folk heroes and deposed him. These heroes are still in charge of the country today.
Currently, the biggest threats facing the fledgling nation are border tensions with Fallencall, the ravenous merchants of Welterglow , and a smooth transition of power.
Emberhaven
Maiden's Plains
Prares

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/azoicmound/azo.title: Azoicmound
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/azoicmound/azo.description: Azoicmound is defined by its relationship to The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms. It is the only country bordering the nation that is allied without being absorbed into it.This country has a long tradition of remaining relatively neutral in conflicts between world powers. The two countries stanch belief in law and belief ties them together, while their religious differences cause tension.Azoicmound is nominally a merit based society, where craftsmanship, hard work, and service are valued above all else. The country is primarily organized into various guilds and unions.

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/barrenbreak/ba.title: Barrenbreak
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/barrenbreak/ba.description:
Barrenbreak is made up of a number of primarily autonomous states. Each is traditionally run by the oldest members of their community, typically from one noble family or clan, and the country as a whole is overseen by one of the eldest representatives from each state. As such, change is slow to come. Trade is done mostly between individual underground cities, oddly enough Barren break does not seem to hold outside farmland, unlike other similarly underground countries.A number of mountain-dwelling communities, consisting mostly of strix and winter kitsune have recently become member states of Barrenbreak as well. Theres also a few dragons and other intelligent beasts whose caves and hordes have been legalized, categorized, and taxed. Despite being magical beats, these creatures are considered full citizens of Barrenbreak and have the full protection of the country behind them.In order to avoid costal raids, a lot of travel is conducted on the underground toll roads of Barrenbreak. They don't sanction anyone from any particular country from entering and using the road, but have yet to allow the armies of The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms or Azoicmound to traverse the tunnels.Attempts from Azoicmound clans have attempted to take a chunk out the outlying states, but cannot compete with the mastery of underground shown by the Barrenbreak skirmishers.
There is no state religion, rather each of the noble households has its own pantheon of minor deities. Azoicmound preachers are often found trying to sneak into Barrenbreak in order to spread the word of the The Pantheon of Earth and Stone .
Gadun

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/bluewall/bluew.title: Bluewall
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/bluewall/bluew.description:
Bluewall is a small island off the coast of Netherrim. The settlement on the island is surrounded, perhaps unsurprising, by a blue wall. It is debated among northern scholars if the wall is literal, magical, or even metaphorical.Only those with express permission are allowed entry to the city. Others are left outside the walls where the islands curse sickens them or driven away by the Nereid protectors of the area. The island used to be a part of Netherrim, but was cursed just the incident that led to the Netherrim wastes. Only a select few families being able to live upon it. It is unclear how the city provides itself with food and water, considering most crops are subject to the curse as well. Oddly enough, sometimes visitors are allowed on the island but there reports are must different than those of errant curse resistant family members. People presumed dead or missing have lived there many years, thought to be completely gone, only to suddenly return on a ship escorted by Nereids.Oddly enough, creatures of the opossum family are plentiful on the island. There are five main families that have freedom to enter and exit Bluewall.
The first is the Kanok Family. Long ago, they escaped the desolate lair of a Spirit Naga and fled to the island. Almost all members of the family have deep purple scales.
The Kai Family is a family of humans whose ancestors once lived in the Plane of Air serving a great and evil air elemental. His great evil cursed them, causing them to emit sot-like smoke. They aren’t welcome in many other countries and found Bluewall the only place they could live comfortably. Any Sylphs, regardless of ancestry, who manifest this strange miasma are happily adopted into the family. Children born of this family who do not find themselves covered in cloying fog are quickly sent off the island.
The Olaf Family is descended from a clan of Azoicmound alchemists and brewers. Their ancient founder was accused of plotting against the core tenants of the country and her entire family was to be sent to death. They escaped and fled to the island, willing to risk its curse only to find they were not affected by it.
Lastly, there are the water dwelling Maelstrom Family. Originally from Levinea , their ancestor fell in love with one of the Nereids who lived near the cursed island. The original ancestor could not bear the curse and got sick often. But the Nereid crafted them a heart shaped amulet that protected them from both the Nereids touch and the curse of the island. When their children were born, they were innately able to withstand the islands‘ curse.
Polris

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/crystalwaters/.title: Crystalwaters
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/crystalwaters/.description: Crystalwater is entirely surrounded by mountains and the country Tawdrywilde. The inhabitants of the nation are quite secluded. They draw magic from the great lake of crystal in the center of the country. They are not unfriendly to outsiders but don’t facilitate travel into the country.

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/easterglen/eas.title: Easterglen
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/easterglen/eas.description:
Easterglen survives by supplying food to the mountain nations of Gold Rocks and Azoicmound. By having a relationship with both, a delicate balance is maintained between the two vastly stronger powers.
Recently, Netherrim has swept up from the south and taken quite a large chunk of farmland for itself, causing both the nearby mountain nations to emerge from their caverns and send troops to fight on the ground. This hasn’t abated the barely covert political scheming from the mountains, both trying to use the war as an opportunity to bring the Easterglen fully under their influence.
Calend
Encass

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/fallencall/bla.title: Blackspire
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/fallencall/bla.description: The capital city of Fallencall, ruled by the Blackfrost. It's leading export is of magical items.

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/fallencall/fal.title: Fallencall
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/fallencall/fal.description:
Fallencall emerged as part of the mage revolution of Ravenyard around the year 200 AC.
In the years after the Raven King's rule, Ravenyard nobility began to elevate mages from the common people to their courts in order to leverage their arcane power against each other. They preferred wizards specifically, because of their versatility. They were not treated fairly in most courts, more as commoner tools to achieve a means to an end. They were encouraged not only to serve their noble lords without question, but to fight and die for them.Around the year 200AC, several noble lords brought their mages with them to a clandestine meeting in the east of the country. At this fateful meeting, the mages were left to their own devices while the Lords drank and made merry, the tradition of wizards being anything less than loyal servants long forgotten, it struck these individuals that the mages they’d been fighting on behalf of their lord were actually the same as they were. Not evil, but pressed into service.These individuals stayed in contact, building networks of court mages. Then, one fateful day, almost all of the court mages in the country revolted. They cut the county clean in two with ease. Claiming the area known as Fallencall for themselves.The attitude of elevating mages from the common people bled into the very foundations of Fallencall. With their newfound independence, the wizards chose to rule above the common people. They separated the country loosely, giving territory to each powerful mage who participated. The mages had no higher authority to answer to, nor any duty to the villages the country happened to swallow up. This lawlessness granted them the freedom to live as they pleased, but also lead to chaos and confusion for those without aptitude for magic.Almost immediately, the wizards descended into infighting. Using powerful magic to exact their rules on other mages and fighting against other mages. Use of the Wish spell particularly was prevalent in this period. The fighting ravaged the country, changing its very geography and leaving it quite unusual and broken up. When it was down to a handful of the most reasonable or strong wizards, they met together and decided upon a set of accords. If one wizard were to violate the rules, they would face retribution from all the other ruling wizards. This included banning of the wish spell for uses beyond the recreation of other spells.Aside from following the provisions, each wizard was free to rule his land and his people as he saw fit. Wizard Lords often raise apprentices out from the common folk, while being careful not to teach them too much. Eventually, one of their apprentices becomes as strong and more clever than they are, and they’re replaced. The new Wizard Lord is then free to reshape his domain as he sees fit.Most Wizard Lords keep their populace healthy and educated, understanding it is in their best interest. Some do not care, using people for cheap labor and discard them, preventing them from escaping through arcane means. These Wizard Lords are usually disposed up when eventually their tyranny combined with the magic that seeps into the very soil of the country to produce a powerful champion of the people.
Blackspire
Bredani
Frostford
Frosthold
The Citadel
Vosnan's Tower

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/gold-rocks/gol.title: Gold Rocks
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/gold-rocks/gol.description:
This mountain country has been ruled by a line of Gold Dragons, The Aurum, since anyone can recall. Many people dwell both on the mountain and within it, bowing to the might of the Aurum. Many Kobolds and lesser dragons live here, but the land is open to all. Those that find themselves estranged or suffocated in Azoicmound often move here where the law is much more relaxed.
Drakemere
The Seat of Draconic Might

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/gold-rocks/the.title: The Seat of Draconic Might
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/gold-rocks/the.sourcePath: Places/Iactaleia/Avasoryd/Gold Rocks/The Seat of Draconic Might.md

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/halcystead/hal.title: Halcystead
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/halcystead/hal.description:
Halcystead used to be a peaceful land ruled by the Halcy Family, until the Sanguine Queen rose up from the local nobility around the year 300. She started at the top of the island with a single settlement and has slowly been encroaching more and more.
The Order of the Pale now functionally rules what is left of Halcystead, fighting off constant encroachments of undead and monstrous beasts. Few civilians actually remain in the country anymore, they either fled to Welterglow and beyond, or have been drafted to support the centuries long war effort.

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/hazelden/hazel.title: Hazelden
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/hazelden/hazel.description:
Around the fall of Netherrim, Hazelden broke off from Thaumdeep and retreated to the forest.Their founder fought in the Great War and fled along with a number of refugees. They swore off meddling with natural order through advances in technology. Instead they live in harmony with nature, considering primal magic to be the only acceptable magic. Worked metal specifically is fully outlawed within Hazelden. Outsiders who lay down their arms and prove they aren’t bringing any metal or magic into the forest are begrudgingly allowed entrance.
Greyoves
Grimwood

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/levinea/levine.title: Levinea
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/levinea/levine.description: This city is the undisputed underwater capital. The seas of Avasoryd are known to be extremely dangerous, but this city state is the bastion of light among the darkness.Azerketi have lived and ruled here since as long as anyone can recall. There is even magic throughout the city that allows air breathing creatures to reside here safely. Many merchants hire Levinean guards to protect their ships from underwater and the city is a thriving trade hub.Recently the city has shut itself off completely from outsiders. The city has disabled the magics that allowed ships to dock above the underwater city and their crews to travel down.

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/lunahelm-raide.title: Lunahelm Raiders
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/lunahelm-raide.description:
The Lunahelm Raiders are defined by their belief in the survival of the fittest. While there are still farmers and settlers in the Raiders, they’re looked down upon compared to the Raiders. These folks mostly consisted of conquered peoples who don’t ascribe to the Blood and Brine need for sailing and violence. They worship The Druidic Order of Blood and Brine, which places emphasis on reincarnation. If one is in an an unfortunate situation, it’s because they weren’t brave enough in a past life. Ones misery and weakness is brought upon themselves. Farming and settling is a waste of time when you could be proving your bravery in hunt and battle to the Gods.A specific massive point of contention and conflict is The Druidic Order of Blood and Brine believes that killing The Chosen will grant ones family incredible luck and benefits in future reincarnations.
Ethlow

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/necromere/necr.title: Necromere
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/necromere/necr.description:
Necromere is the domain of the Sanguine Queen, and she’s been building the domain for around 300 years.Despite the Sanguine Queen's ruthlessness, life in the north of Necromere is mostly normal. Aside from the occasional zombie or crusader burning villages down, as long as peasants don’t cause problems for her and her army, she treats them relatively well. As long as she still has the blood of crusaders to keep her youth and they don’t think about rebelling, there are no issues. She’s even so kind as to order her undead to rebuild the villages that her army tears through on the conquest of the south.
Anceen

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/netherrim/neth.title: Netherrim
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/netherrim/neth.description:
The exact details of how Netherrim was destroyed are lost to time. During the great Founding War, The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch formed the The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms to fight off the warriors of what is now known as Netherrim.This land was once a vibrant alliance of city-states, that were allegedly quite culturally and technologically advanced. Of course, no such proof of this exists in the current day. Apparently, winning the war required every Chosen of the time to join together against them. Many of the events of this war are likely more metaphorical than factual. For example, their Iron War Titans were likely Giants wearing plate mail.At the end of the war, the entire region was desolated, the fertile soils and teaming corral reefs completely wiped from the map. This is likely due to a combination of factors, including soil erosion and other natural phenomena. It seems equally unlikely that a war could truly have this destructive power.Those that survived the war formed a number of separate clans or tribes in order to survive in the wasteland. Due to its complete lack of resources and defensive positions, no pre-existing country claimed a stake in the land. This area was dubbed the Netherrim Waste around 0 BC. There has been silence from the region until the few decades.
A decade ago, an unknown but charismatic leader marched on Easterglen, taking a massive chunk out of the southern farmlands. He had spent quite some time uniting the various groups who'd adapted to survival in the wastes over the past centuries. The self-proclaimed Peoples of Netherrim have begun building cities and farms in the area, leading raids and conquering the territories of Gold Rocks, Easterglen, The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms, and up as far as Amberreach. The generals of the army know how to push heavy terrain advantage that they have in the wastes over to the heavily armored, horse-reliant, or sea-faring armies of their armies.
Old Lonford

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/ravenyard/rave.title: Ravenyard
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/ravenyard/rave.description:
According to legend, Ravenyard was founded two millennia ago as the Kingdom of the Raven. The Raven King raised soldiers from the darkness and swept through almost all of the North, his territory bounded only by the Dwarven mountain tribes to the South, the ancestors of the Lunahelm Raiders to the West. The territory covered most of what is not Fallencall and Amberreach .According to records, he ruled for over a thousand years. Scholars hotly debate this fact as he did not appear in public nor remove his mask for a great deal of that time. During his rule, he slowly parceled off sections of his land to his children, allowing them to take their mother's name and append his surname - Jūn (君), meaning ruler.Each direct child of his formed their own noble house, with the intention that the eldest of descendants would serve on a ruling council. There were over 30 recognized noble families at the time of the Raven King's abdication. The ensuing wars and infighting significantly weakened the country. Over the last millennia, this number has steeply declined. The mage revolt of the 200s also caused a high number of families to lose their lives, titles, or territories.In the current day, there are approximately a dozen noble families in good standing. They oversee the country with minimal public infighting. They follow a feudal system, leasing land to the peasantry. The quality of life of the average common person is dependent on the current lord's benevolence, although most of the wiser lords remain wary that their power is dependent on their people not rising up in anger. Those who are born or marry into any of the -Jun families live in luxury.
Ravenholm

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/tawdrywilde/ta.title: Tawdrywilde
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/tawdrywilde/ta.description:
Tawdrywild is a country full of magic and megafauna, located surrounding the mysterious Crystalwaters.
For unknown reasons, the plants and animals are incredibly large and ferocious. Temperatures also fluctuate strangely here. Even so, the people have carved out a number of cities from the dense forests. Simple magic is also enhanced in certain pockets of the island, making it the perfect place for a school of magic.
Arcanum
Lonake
University of Balance

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/thaumdeep/thau.title: Thaumdeep
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/thaumdeep/thau.description:
The Kingdom of Thaumdeep used to include a handful of underground settlements and a large expanse of sprawling countryside. Their domain included significant portion of what now belongs to Hazelden, Lunahelm Raiders, and The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms.On account of religious and ideological differences, the kingdom didn’t join the alliance of kingdoms around the year 0 and refuses to join to this day. Even while being driven further and further underground over the centuries, the monarchy won’t ally with any of the three nations its warring against.As of the last decade, the country has is now completely retreated to the mountainside and cave systems. The hastily dug tunnels are not the most sturdy, but at least the fighting has been contained to outside the mountain.
Vallora

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-great,-hol.title: Stonehaven
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-great,-hol.description:
Vanidicus
Grandpa Eudes
Sunshine
Dylis
Leylah Fulford
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-great,-hol.sourcePath: Places/Iactaleia/Avasoryd/The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms/Stonehaven.md

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-great,-hol.title: The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-great,-hol.description:
The Alliance of Kingdoms sprung from an agreement created in the war against Netherrim around the year 0. They were united against a great evil by a group of chosen. They understood immediately when the chosen told them of the beliefs of The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch and were United by belief.
Our great country is ruled by The Hand of the Lawful Patriarch. The Right Hand brings the nobility together and makes sure everyone’s interests are attended to. Quality of life in the Alliance is excellent, with a great deal of farmland, trade, and arts.
Stonehaven
Tehmia
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-great,-hol.sourcePath: Places/Iactaleia/Avasoryd/The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms/The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms.md

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-grove-of-c.title: The Grove of Cycles
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-grove-of-c.description:
Long ago, The Grove of Cycles was traditionally only accessible to those who could travel through tree networks. Within the Grove it is said an ancient beast, as wise as he was good. Powerful Druids would go here to seek his wisdom and beseech his aid.During the tumultuous rule of The Raven King, many villagers of Ravenyard were displaced. The wise creature and his followers opened the river pass to allow them safe haven. When the Clans of Barrenbreak formed, those with a penchant for chaos found themselves restricted. The beast again allowed them to live within his domain. More recently, when the Lunahelm Raiders swept up the coast, the Druids opened the mountain pass and allowed them to join their home.Anyone is welcome to live in the Valley, so long as they are good and respectful of nature. The wise creature is considered now to be more of a metaphor for natures wisdom. The Grove itself is now a thriving city grown from trees and existing at one with the natural world.
Sylvoria
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/the-grove-of-c.sourcePath: Places/Iactaleia/Avasoryd/The Grove of Cycles/The Grove of Cycles.md

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/valane/valane..title: Valane
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/valane/valane..description: Valane is a closed off city-state in the middle of the battle between Thaumdeep and The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms. Both countries regularly try to invade Valane to no success.Valane has mysterious technology they use to repel any attacking forces, for some reason however, they do not take the offensive.

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/welterglow/sta.title: Starhaven
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/welterglow/sta.description: The Dropped Anchor

places/iactaleia/avasoryd/welterglow/wel.title: Welterglow
places/iactaleia/avasoryd/welterglow/wel.description:
Welterglow has been the trade capitol of Avasoyrd for the last 600 or so years.It’s currently run by a coalition of Merchant Lords and is politically focused entirely on economic growth at any cost. The mindset that anyone could become a Merchant Lord with enough luck and hard word is incredibly core to the countries belief and keeps the populate in check.
Right now, the Merchant Lords are generally focused on “helping” Amberreach, trading with The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms, and offering any remaining citizens of Halcystead help to the mainland (they can work the cost of it off later).
Cu'Onda Compound
Starhaven

places/iactaleia/willowshore/downtown-wi.title: Downtown Willowshore
places/iactaleia/willowshore/downtown-wi.description:
Downtown Willowshore remains a major hub of activity in town. To the northeast stands the Governor's Manor and office, which also serves as the village’s bank and treasury. South of the manor lie the Imperial Barracks, commanded by Zheng Peng (male human watch officer). To the north of the crossroad is the stage for the village’s weekly Shu Opera performance, which is part of the Seven-Colored Songbird Theater, a venue officiated over by Kazuma Oono (male kitsune director). Nearby on opposite sides of the road is one of Willowshore’s busiest stores, Treesparrow’s Rest, and Willowshore’s only public bathhouse, the Happy Kappa. Treesparrow’s is a family-owned grocery store run by Nadoya Sanmi (female human family matriarch), while the Happy Kappa’s owner, De-Ge Hua (male halfling bathhouse owner) is famous in town for his obsession with cleanliness. Wares: alcohol, bathing, entertainment, grains, household supplies and tools, preserved foods, rations
Governor's Manor
Happy Kappa
Imperial Barracks
Seven-Colored Songbird Theater
Treesparrow’s Rest

places/iactaleia/willowshore/industrial-.title: Industrial District
places/iactaleia/willowshore/industrial-.description:
Willowshore’s Lung Wa lumber bosses had a host of other businesses related to materials taken from the woods. Many industrial workers came to Willowshore explicitly for this work, leaving family and friends behind. After the lumber bosses left, Governor Heh Shan-Bao seized control and ordered the laborers to continue working. Upset that they had no choice in the matter, they’ve been gathering late at night under the guidance of Kawaka Myna (male tengu guild leader), a senior bookmaker, to discuss how they should negotiate with the governor to release those who want to leave and fairly pay those who elect to stay.
With the collapse of Lung Wa, many of the businesses that once thrived here have closed up shop. The only ones still functioning are Cloud Paper House (a paper mill run by Kawaka), Jadeite Essentials (a distillery), and Rebel's Leatherworks (a tannery). Wares: alcohol, essential oils and perfume, glassware and glass items, hide and leather items, paper and paper products such as spellbooks and formula books
Cloud Paper House
Jadeite Essentials
Rebel's Leatherworks

places/iactaleia/willowshore/willowshore.sourcePath: Places/Iactaleia/Willowshore/Willowshore Hinterlands/Gorge of Fangs and Teeth.md

places/iactaleia/willowshore/willowshore.title: Willowshore Hinterlands
places/iactaleia/willowshore/willowshore.description:
Beyond the town’s borders lies the rugged terrain of its hinterlands—rolling forested hills rising to verdant mountains to the west, while to the east, the region’s largest river eventually flows into the Sea of Ghosts. Where this river meets the sea stands Willowshore’s closest neighbor, the coastal fortified market called Karahai, yet even this location is a day’s ride from town.
The immediate hinterlands feature a number of minor sites of interest. The Duyue River is the largest waterway in the region with Willowshore founded on one of its tributaries, the Ceiba River. A shallower tributary, Dragonfly Creek, winds south to an open area of rugged stone known as the Gorge of Fangs and Teeth—a natural quarry that supplied the stone for Willowshore’s roads and foundations. Gourd Lake, downriver from Willowshore, provides excellent fishing, but those who would ply its waters would do well to make offerings to the kappas who dwell in its depths and cavort on its southern shores. Green Silk Peak, nearly 2,000 feet high, is the highest point of elevation in the hinterlands, while the natural sinkholes known as the The Fox’s Eyes are the opposite—barren pits in the ground where nothing grows and gritty water has pooled.
Signs of habitation beyond Willowshore are sparse in the region, but they do exist and are largely abandoned. To the northeast stand the burnt-out ruins of an abandoned roadhouse once known as Canary Inn, while a remote Hunter’s Hut stands near the headwaters of the Duyue River. To the north can be found an old expansion once intended to support Willowshore, but these buildings and farms were soon abandoned when it became apparent the stream that flowed through the area tended to dry up at random intervals each year. To the west, near the source of the Ceiba River, are the remains of the old Lumber Camp abandoned a few years ago by the local lumber lords—a location that’s slowly being reclaimed by the forest. And in the low mountains northwest of town, at the far end of the trail known as Pilgrim's Path, stand the ruins of the Tan Sugi Monastery—a place reputed today to be the den of monsters, ghosts, or worse
The forest surrounding Willowshore is part of the much larger woodland known as Specterwood, although here in Willowshore’s hinterlands, the haunts and ghosts notorious for plaguing these woods aren’t as dangerous. Wildlife is abundant with deer and boars making up the primary large game in the region, and more dangerous predators like black bears, wolves, giant stag beetles, and enormous spiders comprise the greater perils of the hinterlands to those who travel too far from the roads or explore the wilds after dark.
Canary Inn
Dragonfly Creek
Gorge of Fangs and Teeth
Gourd Lake
Green Silk Peak
Hunter’s Hut
Lumber Camp
Pilgrim's Path
Specterwood
Tan Sugi Monastery
Tan Sugi Tree
The Fox’s Eyes

places/iactaleia/willowshore/abandoned-e.title: Abandoned Estates
places/iactaleia/willowshore/abandoned-e.description: The abandoned lumber lords’ estates, after being thoroughly picked clean, were left to serve as the occasional rage room or dare challenge. An abandoned shrine to Lady Astraea sits in one of the houses, and many have questioned if someone should accept the goddess into their home instead of leaving her bereft in the estate ruins.

places/iactaleia/willowshore/bones-of-th.title: Bones of the Forgotten
places/iactaleia/willowshore/bones-of-th.description:
Willowshore, like many remote villages, has its own set of laws. Grievous crimes were punished with exile unless the individual’s skill or knowledge was needed— the punishment was then permanent imprisonment. Executions were rare, as being exiled into Specterwood was often a death sentence in itself.
Particularly vile criminals had a Mark of Crime tattooed onto their scalp, and after death, this tattoo was transferred to the bones through carving, meaning even in death and decomposition, the mark remained. Bodies with a Mark of Crime—be it from Willowshore, another village, or Lung Wa—can only be buried in this overgrown and unkept area. While graves were unmarked in the past, a few wooden posts have been erected recently and paper shuriken hung off them, seemingly in silent protest that the ones buried beneath might have died an unjust death. Or perhaps this is an attempt to stave off the rise of a bitter, vengeful ghost.

places/iactaleia/willowshore/ceiba-creek.title: Ceiba Creek
places/iactaleia/willowshore/ceiba-creek.description: Links into Woodraft Lake

places/iactaleia/willowshore/ceiba-river.title: Ceiba River
places/iactaleia/willowshore/ceiba-river.description: Links into the Woodraft Lake alongside Ceiba Creek

places/iactaleia/willowshore/ceiba-duyue.title: Ceiba-Duyue Exchange
places/iactaleia/willowshore/ceiba-duyue.description: When Governor Heh Shan-Bao took office in Willowshore, he ordered several new warehouses and a trade office to be built here, hoping to expand the town’s industry and connection with the coastal fortress of Karahai. On Granny Hu’s advice, Shan-Bao handpicked the local Do-Yun priest, Kim Gu-won (male human cleric), to take the post of Exchange Manager. Gu-won reluctantly accepted the job, knowing that with what Granny Hu has on him, he wouldn’t be able to refuse. Wares: beverages, divine scrolls, foods and spices, fulus, raw mineral, textiles

places/iactaleia/willowshore/cerulean-te.title: Cerulean Teahouse
places/iactaleia/willowshore/cerulean-te.description:
Willowshore’s lumber bosses thought very highly of themselves, and the idea of mingling with the “common folk” rankled them. Aristocrat Qing Mai-Lai’s solution was the establishment of this fine structure, close to the lumber lords’ estates.
The Cerulean Teahouse took off quickly, thanks to its plentiful offerings of extravagant food, drinks, and performances. However, once the novelty wore off, business quickly died. Still, Mai-Lai persevered, first by changing the teahouse’s focus to banquet catering, then by collaborating with the Leshy's Saloon as a storefront, and finally as a flexible bed‑and-breakfast. Just days after Mai-Lai finally paid off the loan on the property, news of Lung Wa’s collapse reached Willowshore. Mai-Lai called it quits at that point and announced her retirement, but her attempts to transfer control of the Teahouse to family met with complications after it became apparent that none of her relations wanted to move to Willowshore. When Mai-Lai passed away early in the previous winter, ownership of the business was still undetermined, for Mai-Lai never submitted a will. Today, the Cerulean Teahouse stands vacant and is slowly falling into ruin

places/iactaleia/willowshore/dawnstep-br.title: Dawnstep Bridge
places/iactaleia/willowshore/dawnstep-br.description: After the Thrice‑Blessed Brothel was established (but before it became an inn), Willowshore’s population had grown enough in size to be considered a town by Shenmen standards, meaning that a lit lantern must be maintained at all times within the town near the entrance, at a major crossroads, or at a bridge. The lack of a lit lantern at one of these locations suggests that the town is abandoned, which is believed to invite vermin, ghosts, dangerous beasts, and worse. Today, Willowshore features two such lanterns, but the one that stands here, the Eternal Lantern, is both its oldest and most notable.

places/iactaleia/willowshore/dock.html.title: Dock
places/iactaleia/willowshore/dock.html.description: After the construction of the Willowshore Dam, Willowshore’s old dock was blocked off, thus requiring the construction of a new dock at the mouth of the Ceiba River. The new dock is operated and managed by Rajul Samudra (male nagaji shipwright), who was hired by the Ceiba-Duyue Exchange specifically for his boatbuilding skills.Wares: river boat rentals and sales

places/iactaleia/willowshore/duyue-river.title: Duyue River
places/iactaleia/willowshore/duyue-river.description: Links into Woodraft Lake

places/iactaleia/willowshore/fisheries.h.title: Fisheries
places/iactaleia/willowshore/fisheries.h.description: Fish is an important food source for Willowshore. Locals traditionally capture entire schools of fish, preserve those above a certain size, and raise small ones in their backyard ponds. Today, this practice has been expanded, though the fishers have yet to reach a point where the fishery ponds here can be maintained indefinitely. Zataku (female ratfolk fisher) is Willowshore’s foremost fish keeper; her ability to sense weather changes gives her the perfect edge in her occupation. Wares: dried or smoked fish and shrimp, fertilizer, fishing gear, insect bait

places/iactaleia/willowshore/graveside-m.title: Graveside Manners
places/iactaleia/willowshore/graveside-m.description: Willowshore’s residents practiced cremation in its early days to prevent undeath. The tombs in this old cemetery house the urns of many of those early settlers. Today, only a few families use Graveside Manners as a burial ground. The headstones remain free of lichen and moss thanks to the graveyard’s keeper, You So-Jin (female elf herbalist). Wares: alchemical elixirs and tools, alchemical reagents, fresh and dried herbs

places/iactaleia/willowshore/great-willo.title: Great Willow
places/iactaleia/willowshore/great-willo.description: Willowshore rests at the foot of a mountainous region known geographically as the Trimountains, named due to the three major peaks in the area. In her memoir, Master Zhi Hui noted how she found an ancient willow tree of unusual size at the summit of the lowest of these mountains. After befriending the kodama kami who protected the tree, Master Zhi Hui learned vital information that eventually led her to the Tan Sugi grove to the west. For this knowledge, the kodama of the so-called “Great Willow” has received much reverence from both Willowshore and visiting pilgrims over the years. Wares: foraged foods and nonmetallic raw materials

places/iactaleia/willowshore/lady-of-sou.title: Lady of Souls
places/iactaleia/willowshore/lady-of-sou.description: One of Lung Wa’s chief concerns when they first expanded into Willowshore was to reduce the likelihood of an undead uprising. They solved it by building a cathedral to Lady Jansoo. Elizeth Candora (female human cleric), a second-generation Taldan from Goka, is the current priestess here.Wares: consumable religious items, divine scrolls

places/iactaleia/willowshore/leshy's-sal.title: Leshy's Saloon
places/iactaleia/willowshore/leshy's-sal.description: The local leshies don’t recall when they came to the region, just that it was long before Willowshore was founded. They didn’t officially join Willowshore until the expansion of the settlement made it inevitable. With allied families keeping the greedy lumber lords away, the leshies built their own tea farm business, taking to the roads with brewed tea and teaware stashed in rectangular bamboo backpacks. Some would shout slogans, while others used a simple temple block to inform customers of their arrival. These traveling merchants soon became an attraction and staple of Willowshore life. Ever since the Cerulean Teahouse closed, Mountain Summit Grass (agender leshy teamaker), the leader of this band of leshies, has been increasingly focusing on creating bespoke blends of tea for individual local customers they favor. Wares: clay pottery tea ware, tea leaves

places/iactaleia/willowshore/luo-and-law.title: Luo and Laws
places/iactaleia/willowshore/luo-and-law.description: Lung Wa’s laws, after being revised time and time again by self-serving rulers, are a bag of contradictions allowing independent lawyers, such as Luo Xi Yang (female human lawyer), to make a decent living attempting to make sense of them. Promised by the lumber lords who invited her here that rural life would be less stressful, Xi Yang arrived with only the essential 10-volume Imperial Compendium. Quickly, the lawyer discovered that Willowshore’s legal issues were as complicated, if not more so, than what she’d previously encountered in the city of Sze, and thus her library grew to a size that doubled the one in her former home.

places/iactaleia/willowshore/matsuki-est.title: Matsuki Estate
places/iactaleia/willowshore/matsuki-est.description: Matsuki Shou

places/iactaleia/willowshore/mercantile-.title: Mercantile Street
places/iactaleia/willowshore/mercantile-.description: Willowshore’s newer businesses, particularly those associated with woodcarving, are mostly found in one of the two-storied red‑brick buildings along Mercantile Street. To ensure the lumber lords would never favor anyone, the woodcarvers came together to form a guild, through which young apprentices have the opportunity to intern at different shops during their apprenticeship. Yun Mong-Un (female human woodcarver), the woodcarver’s current elected guild leader, is a product of such training. Though heaped with praise for her work, Mong-Un would rather be a painter or jewelry maker. Wares: artwork, wood items, wooden religious symbols

places/iactaleia/willowshore/milling-hou.title: Milling Houses
places/iactaleia/willowshore/milling-hou.description: Willowshore has numerous millhouses, including two powered by water, three by wind, and ten powered by people or draft animals. The abundance ensures that losing one or two mills to routine maintenance or malfunction never jeopardizes the village’s needs. Work at the mills is intense, and the hours can be irregular due to the demand each day. The millers’ leader, Choe Chung-hu (male human miller), keeps morale high with encouragement, pushing back against unreasonable demands, keeping wages stable, and offering midnight snacks. Wares: De-husked grain, grain flour, stone objects

places/iactaleia/willowshore/minister-al.title: Minister Almantas Shrine
places/iactaleia/willowshore/minister-al.description: This darkwood-trimmed shrine houses a 3-foot-tall limestone statue of Minister Almantas that holds a shovel in one hand and a trowel in the other. The statue was reportedly taken to Goka first to ritualistically invite Minister Almantas’s divine blessings at the Grand Bank before being ferried back to Willowshore.

places/iactaleia/willowshore/mother’s-co.title: Mother’s Coil
places/iactaleia/willowshore/mother’s-co.description: Magic was traditionally seen in Willowshore as either a manifestation of divine blessing, one’s connection to the spirit world, or just a trick of the hand and mind. Most folks didn’t quite understand it as a topic to be studied and learned until the arrival of Anjal of Thulsadus, an old nagaji wizard. Arriving about 15 years ago, Anjal found the weather of Willowshore to be gentle on their dryscale condition and thus bought a plot of land from a farmer looking to relocate to the city of Sze. Overnight, a Nagajorstyled tower of dark basalt appeared, much to the awe of the villagers. Though curious about magic, most villagers find the topic to be formidable and unapproachable, not to mention impractical. Thus, Anjal had only one apprentice, Igawa Jubei, a child they raised after she was abandoned in Willowshore by a pair of irresponsible “parents” who posed as well-off merchants but then fled town without paying their bills. Infuriated that anyone dared endanger a child so, Anjal’s Lady Noromian beliefs prompted the old wizard to take the terrified Jubei in as their own. Jubei has since grown into a capable young adult. While Anjal’s death last year was tragic, Jubei is determined to continue studying the arcane arts through the books her adopted parent left behind. Wares: arcane and occult scrolls, formulas and recipes, wands

places/iactaleia/willowshore/mushroom-ho.title: Mushroom House
places/iactaleia/willowshore/mushroom-ho.description: This remote brick farmhouse smells of decay and manure. Everyone knows that mushrooms aren’t the only things growing in the farmhouse, though. For the right price, the Mushroom House can grow almost anything. Luda Bama (female halfling smuggler), a spry, elderly halfling woman, is the head of this illicit market, which she runs with the explicit permission of Granny Hu. Wares: adventuring gear, drugs, poisons, tattoos

places/iactaleia/willowshore/nine-ear-sh.title: Nine Ear Shrine
places/iactaleia/willowshore/nine-ear-sh.description:
This mud-wall hut looks like a grain storage hut from the outside. Its interior descends 10 feet underground into an enclosed space lined with stone, in the middle of which sits a 15-foot‑tall marble statue of a nine‑tailed fox. A large spiritual rope made of hay hangs off its neck. The walls of the basement are decorated with painted carvings that depict stories of Nayeli.
Fifteen years ago, a desperate mother of the Ouh Family hid her baby here as the family was rounded up for execution by a corrupt guard. By the time the guards learned about the missing offspring, a large skulk of foxes had surrounded the temple. Unwilling to tempt divine wrath, the guards retreated. Allies of the family soon arrived to rescue the baby, at which point the foxes vanished.
That baby, Ba-Ming Ouh (female human priest), grew up under the care of distant relatives. While she shows signs of the Ouh family’s inclinations toward the veneration of nature, Ba-Ming wishes to return her life debt by serving Nayeli. While some question her intentions, most Willowshorers support her dedication.Wares: fulus, scrolls, talismans

places/iactaleia/willowshore/second-best.title: Second Best
places/iactaleia/willowshore/second-best.description:
When Huo Tian-Zhe (male human inventor) arrived in Willowshore with his blacksmith father (Tian-Zhe's Father) from Karahai (Willowshore’s closest neighboring settlement to the east) about five years ago to assist with the maintenance of the Willowshore Dam, the urban-born son thought he was about to show the “second-rated smiths of the countryside” how to get things done. Quickly, Tian-Zhe realized his own skills were subpar to even the youngest apprentice of the Eternal Blaze Ironworks and that his fancily-designed farm gadgets were more akin to toys than machines of marvels. Humbled, Tian‑Zhe asked his father to stay in Willowshore so he could learn to be a “smith of use.” Begrudgingly accepting the abrupt request, Tian-Zhe’s father nevertheless gave his son a handful of gold to order a new shop sign. As a reminder to himself, Tian-Zhe boldly named his workshop “Second Best.”
In the last five years, Tian-Zhe’s products have garnered some loyal customers, and his knowledge of machinery won over Yong Wu-Xiu such that the old smith tasked him with the maintenance of the dam.Wares: adventuring tools, alchemical ammunition, alchemical bombs, clockwork gadgets, and simple armor, metal weapons, and shields

places/iactaleia/willowshore/silvermist-.title: Silvermist Lodges
places/iactaleia/willowshore/silvermist-.description: The Silvermist Lodges are split between two small compounds in the woods south of town. At each location, the lodges’ woodwork conforms to the grain of the wood, giving the buildings an organic look associated with elven architecture. In the days when Willowshore first tried to become self‑sufficient, eight elven adventurers came and took up an offer to settle in the village, seeing the request as a short-term contract given their life spans. Though none of these original eight elves live in Willowshore anymore, they left many offspring and descendants behind. Wares: animal parts, snare supplies

places/iactaleia/willowshore/spider-gate.title: Spider Gate
places/iactaleia/willowshore/spider-gate.description:
After the Night of Broken Blades, Willowshore’s governor caved to the demand for a new lantern at the entrance of the town to augment the protection afforded by the Eternal Lantern at the town’s heart. While the original plan was for the carpenters of Willowshore to build a tori gate or Tian-shu gateway on which lanterns could be hung, a Lung Wa aristocrat offered a free stone guardian spider from his garden since it no longer fit in with the garden’s decorations.
Most Willowshorers thought the giant statue was the ugliest thing they’d ever seen. Nevertheless, they assumed the statue housed a guardian spirit and respected it accordingly. In time, villagers accepted their unique entrance guardian, even adopting it as their mascot and naming it “Ugly Cute.” The lantern Ugly Cute holds in its fangs is a regular lantern, unlike the Eternal Lantern found at Dawnstep Bridge, but the people of Willowshore value it just as much and strive to keep it lit at all times.

places/iactaleia/willowshore/the-hand-of.title: The Hand of Spring
places/iactaleia/willowshore/the-hand-of.description: Willowshore relied heavily on home remedies, herbal droughts, and traveling priests for medical care until the arrival of Doctor Damihansig Mababangloob (male human doctor), whom everyone calls Dami for short. Dami uses a mix of acupuncture, purified chemicals, and surgery to provide care. Though his treatments aren’t what Willowshore is used to, Dami has developed quite a reputation for being a charitable doctor who cares more about his patients than monetary gain. Wares: alchemical healing items, healer’s kit supplies, nonmagical healing items

places/iactaleia/willowshore/thrice-bles.title: Thrice-Blessed Inn
places/iactaleia/willowshore/thrice-bles.description: Willowshore’s Thrice-Blessed Inn began as the Thrice‑Blessed Brothel, for it was founded by three clerics of Do-Yun, Nekane Modis, and Nayeli. Political complications forced the brothel’s owner, Mother Otis (genderfluid half-elf innkeeper), to shut down the establishment only a few years before Lung Wa’s collapse. With the aid of Willowshore’s local lawyer, Luo Xi Yang, Mother Otis was able to rely upon an obscure law that prevented their eviction and allowed them to continue to operate the building as an inn.

places/iactaleia/willowshore/willowshore.title: Willowshore Dam
places/iactaleia/willowshore/willowshore.description: Willowshore’s dam is a minor engineering marvel. Its main body is constructed out of immense, precisely fitted slabs of dark‑gray marble, carved with a carefully calculated curvature. The dam has two giant wooden gates that can be closed or opened to lower the level of the lake. Turning the wheel that controls the gates automatically causes a bell to ring, signaling anyone downriver to move away to safetyWoodraft Lake

places/iactaleia/willowshore/willowshore.title: Willowshore Stables
places/iactaleia/willowshore/willowshore.description: Willowshore Stables is the town’s veterinary facility for household animals, pets, and livestock. Incidentally, Willowshore Stables’ use of livestock as beasts of burden influenced the village’s food culture, causing many households to avoid the consumption of beef. The owner, Kum Soon-chong (male human veterinarian), and his teenage son, Meng-sung (male human veterinarian), are well-known for their affable attitudes and compassion for all kinds of animals.Wares: animal rentals, barding, saddle bags, land vehicles

places/iactaleia/willowshore/woodraft-la.title: Woodraft Lake
places/iactaleia/willowshore/woodraft-la.description:
The First Willowshore Governor appointed by Lung Wa made an effort to tame the notorious Ceiba River through various engineering feats. Part of that effort, plus the demand for wet storage for wood, led to the construction of the Willowshore Dam—and by extension, Woodraft Lake.
Many protested the construction at first, as the resulting lake would submerge some homes and farmlands—including the village’s shrine to Nekane Modis. A few imprisonments later, all complaints ceased. The dam was completed in due time. While the governor earned themself a promotion and left Willowshore soon after, they didn’t get to enjoy before a landslide buried them on a bright sunny day. While the story’s veracity is somewhat dubious, subsequent governors have never stopped Willowshore’s villagers from treating the lake as a shrine to the Widow of Suffering.

sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.title: Session 1
sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.description:
Sunny Skies
Dol'ore Ore Zonte
Mavourneen Hannigan & Lir
Brightfang
HuLang
Next: Session 2
We’re on the Windseeker, it’s our boat We’re invited to the captain’s quarters, many people have gathered in hopes of finding new land
We meet the captain, her name is Captain Enu Stormgrip Gives us fancy wayfinders to find each other and the boat, and also 3 mini boats that last a day
Ushers us out and we start talking, meet Azar who is a wizard-in-training We explore the boat a bit, call dibs on some rooms, but the worst guy alive shows up
Straton Nikostratos II
Knights of the Holy Order, has Venian Knights Will kick your teeth in for fun He kicks us out of the rooms that we called dibs on, the first mate he got to tell us seemed very much forced to do so
We go to explore the rest of the vote, we meet Korina Demaki Adventurer, very dressed down but still in armor with many weapons She doesn’t really want to know who we are because she’s seen too many people die and doesn’t want to get attached Sailing montage Dol’ore is training Brightfang is gathering thaumaturgic knick-knacks HuLang is playing music and getting first pick on snacks Sunny is up in the crows nest taking note of creatures nearby Mav is also up there writing notes in her journal and crafting little things Sunny and Mav spot the first birds(?) Not quite bird shaped, and larger than anticipated, but good enough! There’s land nearby! Giant tree in the distance! So big! Looks like bruised broccoli (many colors) and glows at night Gather our stuff so we’re prepared for landfall Uh oh Jumped Merfolk(?) that are gouging holes in the ship, flooding the deck with water, and we get into a fight Not killing, but apprehending people Speaking in a language that is close to Thalassic Seem organized, more militaristic than pirates We escape, without anyone else, but we get a boat to Azar They’re on the move! Venian knights are nowhere to be seen We start heading to shore Lvl 2

sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.title: Session 2
sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.description:
Prev: Session 1
Next: Session 3
Sailing on the Windseeker, headed towards Big Tree (Jatunyana) Is going well? Dol’ore and HuLang notice a group of ppl w tridents following us, maybe a mile away, 5 of them We start taking shifts on rowing They haven’t shown their heads again since we last saw them Mav makes 4 Journeybread for the boyz Spot an outcropping of rocks for us to be able to hunker down Something nested here about a year ago, layed an egg, the egg hatched, and then moved on 2 silhouettes of flying creatures (Giant Vultures) Fight them Nest: Some shells String of pearls, unknown markings wooden coins that shine gold in the light, tree carved x26 Rest for the night Travel for a day, approaching the tree Massive cliffs that rise out of the ocean Boat pulls up, see the cliffs be smooth and flat like cut through butter Able to spot a canyon, straight through, but kind of like a ramp Long straight path that ends in the ocean and goes to the center of the island(?) Run off for rain-water Ankle deep right now, 30ft wide See a number along the cliff sides Very oddly flat No beach slowly meeting up, deep sea up until we arrive at the cliff. Sharp drop-off Looks like the land has been cut out Off in the distance, in the very very distance to the west, giant spires of stone mountains Other side, thick, billowing smoke far far away Like a giant forest fire Starting our journey on land! Wading through ankle deep water

sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.title: Session 3
sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.description:
Prev: Session 2
Next: Session 4 Wade through the river, walls towering over us After a little more than a day, we come across a cavern. Hole in the wall of the cliff? We go inside Over the past maybe months-ish, some creatures come in, animal prints Frequently those prints don’t repeat, but there is a four-legged webbed-foot creature and a bipedal webbed-foot creature We try to rest Something shows up Light is cast, and they scurry away Morning shift Something shows up again Mav tries to sneak up to take a peek She gets spotted. Woopsie!
A crocodile and a Guy (Sedacthy Scout?) (Pengejut) are here and are aggro We kill his croc He cowers, we stop fighting He’s speaking something similar to Thalassic Generally kind of groveling and praising our strength, offering his service Throwing out whatever we might want to hear to get him out of this situation Directing it all to Lir, seems to think that Lir is in charge (due to being an elemental) We try to get across “why”, and we get “to eat” Journeybread “Not much flesh here to eat” “God live in tree” “God? Who’s God?”
“Tumbuh-Tumbuhan - God Tree” “Baby god”
Points to Sunny, rocking motion. “Baby”. Points to Lir. “Mom. Dad. baby sleep in god tree” Pointing in the direction of the fire. “Fire? Burning?”
“Yes.” word conveying volcanic vents at the bottom of the water but not what he means, “Tlahuiaekatl - Volcano Land” and then spits on the ground. “And the mountains?”
“Sthira - steels the bed of the sea to bring it up into the sky” “Are you from the sea?”
“Yes. Abadi Kota, exile” “Why exile?” “Go on out of mother onto rocks. Like so much, stay there forever, they say. No more fish.”`` He doesnt want the journeybread Wants to eat his croc companion “You eat flesh, yes?” “You not?” “Plant eat you. Flesh eat less.” Many such cases of plants = people = creatures Land is confusing to him He’s confused why Dol’Ore wears metal armor “Why metal in plant place?”
“You from Ferreus?” - metal place, over water by the smoke/fire area If not Abadi Kota, no water No large water, must fly Boats can’t go If not belong Abadi Kota, capture “Where do you go when captured?” Down “And if can’t breathe?” “Don’t know. Seen plant try, but should go up if want air.” “Stole what?” “Shiny pearl. Many.” After much deliberation, he’s killed His pockets: 5 coins with the gold on it Salted dubious meat
Our compass points to the center of the island for the Azar dot and the ship dot has been moving in the opposite direction Both now point north, headed in the same direction as the river (into the island) Notice an encampment into the rocks above, if we wave them down we might be able to climb up We grab attention Have Lir circle around, and Mav motions up We climb up Group of generally humanoid, recognizably gnome halfling etc, seem to be wearing fur and leather, no cloth or metal, and no textiles No plant materials, purely animal based Clothes are still well tailored, made with care, don’t have access to textiles Kind of greeting with general respect, esp to Lir Hard to do make out, but make out Abadi Kota, and then bowing and reverence Sunny feels Weird when she steps off the ledge People are talking a lot, but there is an underlying noise that ONLY Sunny can hear, sounds like whispering (terrifying), some songs as we move further into the camp Plants are all in sync and talking to each other all across the island “What are you singing?” “Spring song” “You’re so loud! You’re all together!”
“Yes, one voice. Sacha connects.” “Are you descendants of Sacha?” “Sacha holds our roots, we hold hers. All things are Sacha, except for the flesh that walks atop her roots.” “Is Sacha the God Tree?” “MmmmMMm…. Some Say This… She is us, we are her. All Sacha’s children live in harmony here.” “Am I able to connect with Sacha?” “Ouuhuhh well… you are already! You are Sacha, I am Sacha, We are all… All here is done by her will. Welcome home.”

sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.title: Session 4
sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.description:
Prev: Session 3
Next: Session 5
Jatunyana Meeting person in charge of the town Elven person where moss grows on their face, they seem kinda young Not ancient and wisened They’re trying to communicate politely in a language that isn’t close to Thalassic Becomes clear that we don’t share a language If we’re willing to hear him out Takes a While Gets across the point that he knows 2 different people that he can take us to that speak Thalassic generally 1 is a noble traveler the other is some kind of water fairy
Also tries to get across that Yechaq knows wildsong, but he isn’t here Get escorted to the noble We get packed a basket of dried meats and certain kinds of fruits (apples and fruits that fall off the tree) but not like. A potato or nuts Takes abt half a day of walking, he seems to knows the path Makes a point to wind around things (itd be easier to hack through the dense underbrush) Paths carefully made in dense forest that he follows We arrive to a small house set into a tree, catch some other travelers headed away and some camped out to stay the night of this person Brought inside into tree Explains to a small wooden man (skin is made of wood, he’s bald, and he has no legs, just trails off into a swarm of petals and flowers that stays underneath him) A type of genie, the weakest kind, serve as familiars and messengers to other elementals
Sunny’s heard of them, summoning back in Avasoryd would be like an Idea and not like Some Guy The man asks for us in Thalassic for us to begin speaking, and then casts a spell (comprehend languages) We can talk to him
He thinks we’re from the nation of waves bc of Lir He’s heard mention of them? They know about the mysterious other continent They saw the barrier go down, the lords sent their scrying to see the eater of worlds was reemerging (not the case)
“I will have to speak to my lord before I make a statement of the Council of the Seven Primordial Lords” “We of the primordial elements give much guidance to the people of this land.” There’s political turmoil This tension is probably where they’re making assumptions of where our ship was from He keeps mentioning his “Lady”
Lady Micha Munaspa, highest elemental authority around here Druids of this land can feel when plants are harmed, so one must take caution to avoid causing pain to Lady Sacha
His name is Rimaq We can walk to Lady Micha by the Wine Festival Y’know, the festival about the gifts from the plants It’s done only when the tree releases its fruits to the ground He’s not entirely upfront with us, he’s painting himself and his employer in a good light We go to talk to the “water fairy”
Churiyaku Mu’an - Shattered Common Their domain is a pond and some of an underground river
“My mom lives under the God Tree, she’s old enough to remember before it was here.” All technically under the “Circle of the God Tree”
The Yura Muyushka The group of the non-elemental circle member, there’s one that is dealing with a plant possessing people when they die
Yechaq Circle member! Drops by says hi She draws the outline of an island/continent Drags her fingers through the center and parts of the island, slowly going in and adding details until we have a basic map
Bottom is covered by smoke (disgusting pollution)
Tlahuiaekatl - Volcano
Alhadarat Alsahabia - Air World
Abadi Kota - Outside water
Sthira - The earth
Jatunyana - Tree section
Ferreus - Smog filled Metal Land The lines = Big fight, said fighting caused giant rifts in the islands Their mom said it happened, but they can’t imagine something big enough to cause giant slashes in an island They think it’s a metaphor for unity (all came from one place but all divided) There’s not a lot of sources of fresh water, and they believe they’re dealing with an unreasonable amount of mortals The wood lord doesn’t take care of the people They owe no allegiance to the wood lord Their mom says that the water fairies were here before the wood elementals
Abadi Kota doesn’t let many ships across the sea, and those that they do let thru are escorted the whole way
Ppl have tried to escape to Sthira
Elemental lords dont super like subjects leaving, wooden boats are often captured and returned to Jatunyana There’s been a little bit of burning down of forests that belong to the Lords They think it’s people who are unhappy
Yachaq thinks it’s Tlahuiaekatl trying to expand If a general sees a ship that’s not being guarded by someone of importance in Abadi Kota they sink or take the boat Their mom is very pretty and physically tall and wide It’d be nice to be connected to a river that their sisters are in

sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.title: Session 5
sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.description:
Prev: Session 4
Next: Session 6
Jatunyana On our journey, plants part to give us a path straight down the middle to the center Day 1 Join up a path that seems to be open all the time, allowing foot travel all the time At the end of the day, he takes care of the encampment Small domed enclosures with branches and moss on the ground Tiny hut shaped Pile in, he speaks politely to the branches and they seal back up There’s no need to stay up and take watch He takes a meditation Outside, nocturnal animals beginning their hunts Lots of activity in the night Hear the structure get pawed at, nothing gets in it Structure grows berries, and drops them into a bowl on the floor People outside of a city/structure would get attacked “All manner of beings must eat” “All the animals in the capital city are very docile” You have to talk to plants to be able to travel Animals can’t get close to us without the ground moving under them Not many herbivores out here If there are no herbivores, what are the carnivores eating?
Some herbivore pens away from the God Tree’s branches so they don’t feel the pain of the grass being eaten Guys this fucking sucks Day 2 Small roadside shrine Cube hanging that is painted so that each side is a different color White, green, silver, blue, brown, red 6 shrines Travelers have brought offerings Shrines to water earth air and wood have things on them, mostly animal based and/or someone grew an object out of wood and placed it here Flowers growing around the wood shrine Small squares of leather with things painted on them Metal and fire take up a ⅙ each, but very empty, no one is taking care of this area Official stance is that this is a decision of the populace’s prejudices in their hearts “Should all be open to elemental neighbors despite how different their lifestyles may be” Sunny puts some silver pieces on each shrine space Shrine to wood god is a replication of the tree growing in the center of the island Hut is thicker this time Day 3 We pass by a group of people who have set up camp alongside the road They’re tending to a couple wounded members of their group, maybe 10 people here They clearly have their hands outstretched to our tour guide “These people are pilgrims journeying to the tree. They are asking for a blessing of a wood elemental.” “They should have a druid” (they don’t). He doesn’t want us to stop and help them, but we do
They think Sunny is part of the Yura Muyushka Dol’Ore gives them some rations They’re initially very wary of the processed grains HuLang asks them where they’re going
Kawsay, seeing Yura Muyushka Also points at the giant tree We tell our guide that they’re coming with us They teach us some words, we teach them some words They offer to show us some places if we wanted, very friendly, always happy to show us to their home Day 4 Smoke ahead 2 young people come running in our direction See us, freeze, hesitate, one has a flint We decide to let the boys to leave, rush to the tree The mortals with us let out a breath of relief The boys leave
We chuck (some Lir) water on the tree Day 5 As we approach the tree, one of the creatures that we saw that was too big to be a bird, seems to be a reptile winged creature made of tree branches and flowers Carrying an entire person as it goes up to the branches within the tree “Pets of some of the lords of the land. They craft them from a thousand colorful snapdragon flowers. They’re called Snapdrakes.” Probably shouldn’t anger one Person is so being brought to justice in a good way. (I smell bullshit) In the capital now Our compass points here, now in range of being more specific
Captain Enu Stormgrip’s co-ords are still further away

sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.title: Session 6
sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.description:
Prev: Session 5
Next: Session 7


Jatunyana
Arrive at the base of the tree Sacha It seems like there is an intersection of 6 rivers (tho it could only be three) around the base of the tree All 6 rivers feed the tree We are arriving at the west Guide leading us to the tree trunk (tree is about 90 stories tall) Stairs “built” in About 10k people here Surrounding major cities have roughly 5k in each 6 largest cities The woman in charge that we’ve grown to know the past couple days
Her name is Teij Nelsi She presses a small wooden (carved) token into Dol’ore’s hand Making sure she isn’t seen by our guide Gives a thanks, conveys that this is an item of importance Her group is nervous and steeling themselves for the deal ahead (a temple to head to) Point out northern building Going to request a new druid for their town As we ascend the stairs, the compass begins to point to opposite sides of the tree for people
Red dot = Azar, west area In the direction of the central sea It’d take half a day to climb the stairs We go, uh, no?? Cant we take the ‘elevator’?? Talking to people guarding the lift system
Are we visiting House Munaspa or House Chakuq or House Teijnelsi? We get let through Someone with woven robes asks the tree to lift us up to the next layer 1st layer of tree
Our guide lets us know that lady Micha Munaspa’s mansion is halfway to the next layer This layer is much less crowded, ppl are less hurried and truly elemental instead of planar Most are more element of wood (not like a noble element of wood) or adjacent Stairs are still crowded, but pilgrimage people are mostly contained Building Azar in is a PRISON People would spend their entire lives in there We would need approval from Lady Munaspa or the mayor(?)
Munaspa Mansion Many people here
We are introduced with Palla in front of our names (Noble), and Yupanqui for Lir She dismisses him “I don’t necessarily see why your specific presence is necessary.” She gets wine for us She’s honored to be the 2nd nation that has had contact from those from the Sealed Lands
There’s been political tension between this nation and the fire nation where they’ve sent ships here or destroyed swaths of land for ships Dol’ore tells her that we’re but the diplomacy vessel, the others that may come are soldiers (Lying) There might be another war? Northern neighbors and the lands made of bones came down to figure out what they might find It was an attempt to incorporate this land into their nations
The God Eater eats gods, the more divine intervention there was meant the more the god eater grew
So to weaken it back to a scale that is possible to imagine, it was sealed in an area without gods More like, free of direct intervention of extra-planar beings Level 3!

sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.title: Session 7
sessions/sailors-of-the-shattered-seas/s.description:
Prev: Session 6
Next: Session 8
We spend some time talking to Lady Micha Munaspa and then she has to have a meeting, so she steps away Another tiny wooden man brings a normal looking person??? Wow!!!
Féchín Doesn’t remember how they got here, just woke up here, like they got teleported Nightglider Strix Been having strange dreams, sometimes wakes up somewhere else but never this far??? Munaspa comes back with a person who is abt 7 feet tall, giant bird wings, they thank her for her hospitality and then fly off to the area they will be staying on Talking to Munaspa How would we negotiate the release of our guys from the ship? She could send one of her stewards with us to the prison to see if they can be released, or if not released, then re-tried with further context provided by us Could we use someone to send word back home to make sure they don’t send a warship after us Yeah, one of the cleric librarians could inscribe Sending onto vellum for us to use Who is the person in power for each area

Atlak Xitlati
Permaisuri Amanat
Kada Dhunga
Naeim Safir
Vergo Quaestus
By right, the (Nine then corrected to) Council of the Seven Primordial Lords, each of which is distributed a land and the last of which wanders about, is the rightful ruler, though not necessarily the current ruler, the eldest of elementals after the conclusion of the war
- Micha Munaspa, ruler of Jatunyana - Eldest son died in brutal uprising, related to the land of Volcanoes
- Atlak Xitlati, first lord of Tlahuiaekatl - Father was killed in brutal uprising related to the land of Volcanoes - Extremely tall, horned, covered in gold jewelry - Red skin, several different shades of flame, you can see it move under his skin - Currently seeking refuge in the Sky Cities - Munaspa believes many of the issues going on in Jatunyana wouldn’t be happening if he was in power - Land of Volcanoes is ruled nominally by priests but in practice just a bunch of infighting
- Permaisuri Amanat, Abadi Kota (Water Lady of house Water Lady) - Charismatic woman - Blue skin with pink - Long beautiful hair - Very diplomatic and kind
- Kada Dhunga, Sthira - Made of stone, very sturdy and strong, values strength and trade - Also enjoys jewelry - Of house That One
- Kindly abdicated his seat on behalf of the followers of Stone Deity, Stone Clerics are in charge of the nation now - Munaspa believes he should be back on the throne but he thinks he’s better served in an unofficial capacity
- Naeim Safir, Alhadarat Alsahabia - Blue and white woman, translucent, hard to see because she’s made of air - The shortest of the gang
- Vergo Quaestus, Metal Land
- Rightful ruler of Ferreus - Deposed, replaced with worshippers of metal deity
- The Wanderer - They are the most ancient of them, winged-finned-horned person - They change appearance, we will know them when we see them - Every element at once - Both the strongest and the weakest of them - Only seen every so often when the Lords have their meeting What major events have been happening here? Political tension between insurgent terrorists and their rightful lords Main concern according to Munaspa Giant expanse of burned land is recent, within the last 50 years How did the power dispute happen, was it fighting between heirs? No not at ALL, Lords don’t die until they are killed so they know they won’t inherit the throne unless she is Murdered. She tries to offer a nice life so they don’t DO THAT It HAS happened elsewhere though In the case of the former Xitlati head, his first and second son survived Mostly mortals “attempting to change the natural order of things” “We elementals have a good sense of the proper order of things” How exactly are mortals changing the natural order? Well………….. They might want the Mob Decision on who should be in power, or rule by might, instead of by who is eldest and wisest
Different ideas about the status of the God Tree, some have talked about it, but they can’t feel that it’s a living being that can feel pain “Mortal trouble with empathy and perspective” How did you get to be Lords? We were the oldest when we arrived here From where?
Originally from the Elemental Planes Why did you leave the planes if you could rule there?
Well she could have ruled over some of the plane, but during the God Eater War, they chose to remain here in this world after it was all sorted to “keep an eye on everything”, meaning the Sealed Continent Other creatures returned home but the Lords stayed, they were chosen to watch over the Sealed Continent. If we cast a banishing spell they would not return to the elemental planes, they’d stay right here! Was done during the God Eater War, has not been reversed If they remain here it’s important for them to do what is best for the land Some have a desire to go home but it’s their noble duty to stay here, it’s been researched but Munaspa is of the opinion that this place is their home now, others are still looking for a way to undo the binding so they can go home Separation of elements, why is that It has to do with how the planes overlapped when the ritual to bring them here happened, Munaspa calls it a divine wish in her opinion It overlapped the planes so they existed here and there in the same place and time so they could just jump between Where the overlaps formed it changed the landscape of this world and infused certain areas with remnants of the planes “Theres just no way this could be reversed, we have to make the best” What of those born of hybrid elements They are generally expected to stay in the land they were born or the land they are an elemental of What determines where humanoids can live Where they’re born, sometimes they request people to move to other more appropriate areas to preserve the forest What if they don’t want to?
I don’t think we’ve ever really had that issue, everyone understands why it’s a necessity to move around, the Yura Muyushka handles the education on this topic How does the money making process work if theyre all connected to the trees (Guy) has a grove in their manor that the YM manage where they grow trees that grow the coins?! Money grows on trees……… It will eventually dissolve back into the earth, they add to circulation roughly as fast as it degrades Like 50 years though, they’re sturdy What about the Big Creatures that embody elements that are more powerful than nations, are they worshipped as gods? They’re respected but since the Lords can communicate with them directly, typically they’re moreso honored guests of the land, the YM provide them an escort and guide We are So Peacepilled and Friendlycore that we are not worried about the dangerous ones, either the druids are so fucking cracked that it ain’t a problem or she doesn’t want us to know its a problem What are the relations between the nations? We all seek to be as balanced as possible in emulation of the planes and come to an understanding despite our differences She said, you know, like a liar
We head to the Great Library and are brought to a specific room in the Great Library Hollowed out tree There is a woman organizing the books All vellum, not paper We let her know that we need scrolls of sending to contact the lost continent 2 days to get 6 scrolls We offer help “Mortal to mortal, I am very afraid of bugs,,,,” Some big bugs have come out from the bottom of the tree and she can’t talk to them to ask them to leave and they are eating the books!!! She asks us to go down and deal with the bugs Halfling sized big The bugs are on the first floor of the library We kill the bugs and go back to Munaspa town We meet the steward that will accompany us to the prison Tree lady
We provide a Rough Description of Azar to her We go to the prison People act like it’s very rehabilitative but it definitely isnt Steward takes us to an area of the prison that has cells made of STONE, that’s weird, they’re held up by roots but the cells are stone We see a number of people with red hair or hair on fire or normal but with hands bound that they can’t use their fingers This section is for the Fire Boys WE FIND AZAR!!!! Huddled in the back of a cell, in prison clothes but got to keep their glasses! Missing wizard robes, He lit a section of the forest on fire?????? Scary,,,, He started a campfire……….. Oh bubby….. We convince her to let him out We go back to our quarters We pick our rooms! We are figuring out whose house sigil we want to take if anyone’s
We take the symbol of House Chakuq The mayor

Head to the bar (Pillpintu Bar) Many people Fanciful liquids Man spots us, asks if we’re new Human man, 5’6”, nice clothes Drinks are nectar fermented with honey Brew master is a giant moth Money is very confusing Coins break apart into segments to show smaller legal tender Cloud city does barter and trade entirely This guy is an artist
There are artists sponsored by the Yura Muyushka The highest honor is being given a dead piece of the god tree to paint on This guy is 30 but has been able to do it twice
Sumaq Ruway Some guys have been eyeing him - He’s infamous for some reason He had an incident with the mayor’s consort “Misunderstood their monogamousness” The guys show up and start accusing Sumaq of sleeping with family members (wives, sisters, nephews, etc) Try to start a bar fight “Not my fault married women want to sleep with me” Drunk men are convinced to leave
Lady Micha Munaspa tells the Yura Muyushka what to do, and they don’t really like that Sumaq grew up in one of the nomadic groups in the swamp area (to the west) Made something that the druids had a connection to out of clay Of a bird Crow Similar to Fechin’s familiar Said it had some importance to them 1 Coin = 10gp 1/10th = 1gp We go to market
